reddit.description:
I bought around 50 bucks worth of Litecoin on Bitstamp, and used it to buy around 40 bucks of merchandise on some website. After fees, that left me with around 7 bucks worth of Litecoin left in my wallet. I can't withdraw it because of the 25 dollar minimum, and I dont feel like trying to deposit more money into the account so I can withdraw. I also want to delete my Bitstamp account soon. I figured that I would rather give the money to an actual person on Reddit than give it to Bitstamp.

Leave

reddit.description:
Exactly three years ago, on this day.
LTC ~40
BTC ~2500

Today:
LTC ~40
BTC ~10000

Not trying to start the price discussion, but to comprehend what this means. 
Has the usage of LTC remained the same?
Little to no new demand?

BTC on the other hand had two forks, haven’t heard anything spectacular had happened, yet it grew 4 times, and even more considering there were forks in between.

reddit.description:
So I came into crypto fairly late. Started mining a few months ago, first with CPU, then GPU, then ASICs. Figured out how to set up a full node on a Raspberry Pi 4.

I wholeheartedly want to see Litecoin succeed, along with Bitcoin. I have concerns about Bitcoins viability with so much of the hashing power belonging to a particular region...51% attack could be a thing. For this reason, among others, I want to see Litecoin grow.
